title: Biogen to Sell Biosimilar-Venture Stake to Partner Samsung Biologics
sub_head: Deal for its 50% ownership of the joint venture would bring the company at least $2.25 billion
body:
Biogen Inc. is selling its share in biosimilar joint venture Samsung Bioepis for at least $2.25 billion to partner Samsung Biologics , adding to its cash pile after the disappointing launch of its Alzheimerâ€™s disease drug Aduhelm.
Biogen and Samsung Biologics created Samsung Bioepis in 2012 to develop, manufacture and market biosimilar drugs, lower-priced copies of drugs made from living cells, including the rheumatoid-arthritis treatments Enbrel and Humira.
